title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
Hello gents. 

Got a board that originally came in for power failure. Found two caps that were lifted off their pads. This restore power once resoldered. But I?m not getting any image on the display. I do however get video via the usb-c to hdmi to external display  

I?ve got the below measurements:

PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT_R: 12v
PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT: 0v
EDP_BKLT_EN: 0v

I?m waiting on a donor board to arrive and I was going to replace U9800, but wanted to see if you all had any other suggestions. Thanks.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
Any liquid sign on backlight area, or LCD connector?
Do you get image, only missing backlight?

Check in the first moments if U8500/01 get output voltage; at least 1-2s pulse...

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: Also have you tried a known good screen?

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
Sorry for the late response

U8500/01 is 5v
U8500/05 is 5v

No image on the screen at all.

And yes, known good screen. Confirmed with another board that the screen was good.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
"U8500/01 is 5v
U8500/05 is 5v"
I do NOT really know how to interpret this...
U8501 doesn't have any pin connected to 5V!!!

BTW, U8500/01 means U8500 AND U8501...
Both chips have the output on pin 5.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
Yeah was wondering if it was a typo as pin 1 of u8500 was an input pin hence why I included pin 5s reading. Sorry bout that.

Anyway, U8501 pin5 is 3.3v
U8500 pin5 is 5v

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
Are these stable voltages?
Check them with LCD connected.
If yes, DP_INT_HPD should be high too.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: Yes they are all stable and all measurements were taken with the display connected. I?ll get the measurement later today, running out of town for a bit.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: So with display connected, DP_INT_HPD is 3.3v approx.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
Then you should have image at least, on internal LCD.
Try replacing U9850...

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: I have a donor board coming in next week. I'll let you know the outcome once swapped.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message:
U9850 doesn't have board specific firmware.
You can use new one.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: Finally got the chip and replaced. Still no video on display.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: Should I go ahead and replace U9800 or are there other items that could be causing EDP_BKLT_EN to be 0v?

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: U9800 supposed to have firmware; try to replace it.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: I Replaced U9800 from identical donor board, still no image on display. External display still works.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: Maybe some knocked off component, broken trace, or bad contacts at J8500.

title: 820-00281: No image on display. External works
message: So decided to check in diode mode the values of all the pins on J8500, found out that U9850 that I had installed was bad. So ordered replacement from china and board now feeding image to display. Thanks guys for the assist again. This board is now fixed.
